title: Mystery hum keeps this woman awake for months - and she's 'losing her mind'
text:

Pat Bathe says she is losing her mind because a mysterious mechanical droning noise has been keeping her awake for nine months.

The busy 65-year-old works 12-hour shifts in a care home's laundry room and is often up before 6am.

But when she comes home for a well-earned rest she says she's being driven round the bend by the unknown noise, even snapping at people at work.

The mother-of-one's says the noise starts in earnest after 9.30pm every night - and it's very loud.

Now she wants Stoke-on-Trent CIity Council to fully investigate her complaint, report the Stoke Sentinel.

(Image: Kerry Ashdown)

She said: "The council has suggested putting a noise monitor in, but a noise monitor is not going to fix the problem.

"It has even been suggested that I could be hearing things. But I'm not and this has been going on for nine months.

"It's an up-and-down humming noise, it's there in the daytime but not as noticeable. And then at night it's very loud, like a lorry or a refrigerator.

"I have to come down and sleep on the sofa, which I shouldn't have to do.

"I've even looked on the internet and it could be underwater pumps, pipes or a transformer. But there isn't a transformer near my house.

"I've even had to go to the doctors to get sleeping tablets but they only give out a week's supply at a time. And earplugs are very uncomfortable.

(Image: 1+1 TV/east2west news)

"It's getting to me. If I stopped paying the rent the council would soon come to my house.

"If I could afford to go private and move I would. But the problem would still be here for the next person. I've just had enough.

"Even at work I'm snapping. Now everybody is saying I look tired, well you try living with it."

Son Andy Bathe no longer lives at his mum's Smallthorne home.

But the insurance consultant has heard the same noises as his mum.

The 43-year-old said: "The last time I came up, it sounded like next door had a hot tub running.

"It's like a droning noise. You hear it all night. It sounds like it's coming from the wall next door but up in the attic."

Andy has his own theory for the source of the noise.

He added: "My mum had her gravity water tank removed by the council some time ago and now has a combi-boiler.

"If they haven't removed the electric side of the hot water system that was up in the attic beforehand and it's kicking in at night to heat up a tank that's not there then it could be that. That's my guess."

The council has visited Pat and spoken to her neighbours.

Councillor Joanne Powell-Beckett, cabinet member for housing ,said: “We have been in contact with Mrs Bathe since she first reported noises in her property in February, 2019.

“We have investigated the property for noise and have not picked anything up ourselves. We have also spoken to neighbours in surrounding properties who have not heard the noise.

“We treat all issues reported to us by tenants seriously and will continue to work with Mrs Bathe to investigate the problem.”
